content.description: on a short but very steep boulder, tufas and slopers, dont fall on the sharp log
content.location: up a trail to the left of the main wall

content.description: Squat start on the slopey rail and go straight up the clean face using the obvious pocket, crimp, and slots to top out. Climbs like a dream with some killer cool holds, and core-intensive movement.
content.location: Located above the Flu boulder at the top of the Flu area.

content.description: Sit start tufa, right hand undercling, left hand up to horizontal rail, right hand Gaston pocket, left hand up and finish on arete. Great problem!
content.location: Right side of Reality Check boulder.

content.description: Sit start with obvious sidepulls on the wide tufa. Make compression moves up the juggy tufa to a somewhat slopey top out. It is still a bit sandy but worth doing if you are in the area.
content.location: The right most problem on the Flu boulder.

content.description: Shadowboxing is marred only by a very contrived start on two low and sharp crimpers.  Try hard to not dab and grab the jug flake then follow good holds to some crimpers over the lip.  Give it some grrr to better holds left and above you to a long low-angle finish on cool featured rock.  If the obvious start is followed (HUGE flake jug that is apparently off?) This could probably be V4/5 and really good.  Given 3 of 3 stars and V7 in the PDF, lets not kid ourselves here...
content.location: One of the first boulders you come to in the main concentration of the flu

content.description:
Sea Cow is on the ‘To Far From the Car’ boulder which is the first boulder you get to if you take the the first right on the approach trail after about 200 yards.

Basically a techy, get-up-on-your-feet, small crimp, to easy top out that probably has a few ways to get ‘er done.

Start on jugs under the roof to jugs on the face. Get on your feet and use whatever shallow and/or sharp pocket to get over your feet and top out on slopers. Good one that is not far from the car...
content.location: See above. Download the Flu pdf guide.

content.description: Start on tufa to the left of the start of Whiskey in A Tea Cup.   A bit sandy on the top out.
content.location: Left of Whiskey in a Tea Cup

content.description: Start low and climb up this lowball problem.
content.location: First boulder as you begin the steep uphill trail into the Flu area.

content.description: On the downhill side of candy paint boulder. Sit start matched on low pocket. Climb up the middle of the face.
Unique feature on "The Flu" boulder just left of the flu. Start matched low, work up to an undercling, a small edge and a dynamic move to a slopey jug.
content.location: Located way up the hill in Right Fork

content.description: Climbs out of the overhanging cave and into Raw Hide. Start with left and right hands on different pinches, then move out using good edges and feet. Depending on your size, there are opportunities for creative drop knees, knee bars, and heel hooks.
content.location:
Immediately left of

Rawhide

.

content.description: Stand start on right hand pocket (as sidepull or undercling) and left hand crimp.  Dyno to the lip.
Right side of same wall as Candy Paint problem.
Sit-start with a left hand sidepull and right hand flat edge, work up and left on small crimps and do a big move to a ledge before topping out on Candy Paint.
content.location: Middle of the Candy Paint boulder, just right of Candy Paint V3.

content.description: Starts on a tufa and works into a roof and then into a crimp you face guarding the top out.
content.location: Namesake boulder, quite a ways past the Candy Paint boulder. Right of Pandemic.

content.description: Start on two good crimps. Dyno up and right to set-back dish at lip.
content.location: On left end of same side of boulder as The Flu and Pandemic.

content.description:
Fun and unique! Sit start low and to the right and climb up into the "Huevo" on massive jugs to a spot where you can go no hands. Enjoy being inside the egg for a moment, and then pull on to the lip of the boulder, traverse left a bit, and top out/mantle off of really bad holds.

Great boulder and worth seeking out!
content.location: This one is kind of out on its own. When looking up hill from the candy paint boulder, it is straight right past the "Reality Check" boulder. The huge hueco is easy to identify on the boulder.

content.description: Start on good holds and follow rail/crack right to jugs. Top feels tall as landing drops off out right.
content.location: Candy Paint boulder

content.description: This is a great shorty with cool holds on perfect rock. Sit start on a decent crimp rail with bad feet, move up to sloping crimps, and hit the sloper/jug pocket and the lip. Delicious.
content.location: On the uphill side of the Candy Paint Boulder.

content.description: Fun steep climbing
content.location: Climbs between and underneath 2 boulders that rest on each other.

content.description:
From the Guide:

"Joe’s ValleyStart with right hand and right heel in hueco, left hand starts in finger bucket. Move right hand to the side pull and make a big left hand move to the jug. Easy mantel."

May want a spotter for this one as there is a drop off not far from the landing.
content.location: Candy Paint Boulder. Just left of "Rims Still Spinnin" on the North West facing arete.

content.description: On the classic flu boulder, this sit starts on the same holds as pandemic and shares the same first move left to the jug.  Then this route diverges left, through some nice small black crimps, bad feet, and a big smack into the same hueco that epidemic finishes on.
content.location: Same boulder as the flu, shares start holds with pandemic but finishes to the left.

content.description: Begins left hand on the arete and right hand on a blocky crimp. First move bumps right hand to a nice edgy hold, which would make sense to start on, but that's where the FA started. Choose your own adventure
content.protection: this boulder is very long so a few pads are ideal, and a spotter to shuffle them
content.location: opposite from white buffalo on the same boulder just uphill from the flu

content.description: Start matched on rail.   Its a shorty with some nice crimps and an easy top out.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads, a spotter is more helpful than the pads due to the rocks behind it.
content.location: Left, high side of Candy Paint boulder.
